2Compiling
To compile the example:
Start Visual Studio .NET
Choose Open Project from the File menu.
Navigate to <EiffelEnvision_installation_path>\envision\examples\wel\splitarea\ and select split_area_demo.eifp
Clicking open loads the selected project
Launch EiffelStudio.
Click Add project
Browse to $ISE_EIFFEL\examples\wel\splitarea\.
Choose split_area.ecf
Choose the location where the project will be compiled, by default the same directory containing the configuration file.
Click OK.
2Running After launching the program, a window will be displayed containing a pair of ../../reference/wel_rich_edit_chart.xmlWEL_RICH_EDIT in a split area. Clicking the mouse on the split area (between the two rich edits) and dragging the mouse, will adjust the split area and its content accordingly.
2Under the Hood
There is no split area class provided with WEL, but WEL_SPLIT_AREA was created for this sample to illustrate how new controls can be built when required. Redefining some of the `on_' features inherited from ../../reference/wel_window_chart.xmlWEL_WINDOW in WEL_SPLIT_AREA shows how the control over the contents of the split area is achieved. This sample contains the following classes:
APPLICATION
SPLIT_AREA_DEMO
WEL_SPLIT_AREA
